column4: how do i list the network adaptors in my system again erUSUL?
partitions have to be unmounted if you wish to edit them (grow, shrink, delete)
when you unmount a partition you can't access it's data
as long as the filesystem type is supported
if you format your windows partition it will lose all its data
if you want the recovery partition you can keep it, entirely your choice
will what work? formattng the partition? yes. writing to it? depends what you format it as, but again should be yes
is it recommended to keep the windows reinstall partition?
that entirely depends on whether you want to keep it, in my experience its always been a waste of space because i have windows install disks if i want to install windows
you can do all that, it depends on what you're comfortable with
i hope you enjoy using ubuntu, i certainly prefer linux over windows
yes, you can resize the partition later
